name: Lisa Kudrow

structured_info.background: Born July 30, 1963, in Encino, California, to a travel agent and a doctor with Jewish familial roots from Belarus, Russia, and Hungary. Lisa Kudrow holds a degree in biology from Vassar College and was a varsity tennis player in high school and college.

summary: Lisa Kudrow is an American actress, writer, and producer best known for her iconic role as Phoebe Buffay on the sitcom *Friends*, for which she won a Screen Actors Guild Award and received an Emmy nomination. She is also recognized for creating, writing, and starring in *Web Therapy*, earning her multiple awards and nominations, and for appearances in various films and television shows.

name: Courteney Cox

structured_info.background: Cox achieved significant fame co-starring in *Friends* alongside Lisa Kudrow and Jennifer Aniston, becoming one of the highest-paid television actresses. She also received a Webby Award nomination for her guest appearance in a web series.

summary: Courteney Cox is a highly successful actress best known for her role on *Friends* and later *Cougar Town*. She is also recognized for her work in web series and has received accolades for her performances.

name: Jon Lovitz

structured_info.background: Jon Lovitz is known for his work in comedy and has a childhood connection with Lisa Kudrow.

summary: Jon Lovitz is a comedian and actor, and a childhood friend of Lisa Kudrow.

name: Robin Wright

structured_info.background: Attended Portera Middle School alongside Lisa Kudrow.

summary: Robin Wright is an actress who notably attended school with Lisa Kudrow.

name: Illya Kudrow

structured_info.background: Illya Kudrow's maternal great-grandmother was of Belarusian, German, Hungarian, and Polish Jewish descent and a Holocaust survivor.

summary: Illya Kudrow's family history includes a maternal great-grandmother who survived the Holocaust and had roots in several Eastern and Central European countries.
